column4: hi, i just installed the openssh server but i can't get a command prompt when i shell in to my box.  do i need to configure it to use a different login shell?
i have openssh-client and openssh-server installed
its been a few years since I worked with that
if you remind me what they do it might ring a bell.
openssh-server allows you to connect to your box via ssh and and adminster it remotely
start the server daemon... you will need to config the user log in and any shell will owrk.  On the remote machine just ssh blah
how do i start the server daemon?  i can already ssh to localhost, so perhaps this means it is running but not properly configured.
to start the deamon try sshd
it says "sshd re-exec requires execution with an absolute path"
hmm... I've never seen that... try /locate sshd and then /usr/local or wherever it lives
actually /usr/sbin/sshd is already running when i do ps
ok - then the issue is in /etc/sshd
ok - then the issue is in /etc/sshd.config or whatiever its called.  I can check mine
the thing is i can login to my box, but i cannot get a shell
it seems to me that it does not know it needs to give me a bash shell when i log in
